intro: Hesperis limosellodes, commonly known as the narrowleaf sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and riverbanks, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are pale purple to white, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. Hesperis limosellodes is often found in temperate regions and is known for its delicate, fragrant blooms.
